author: radekkapka
content: I have a quite random question. Will there be a time when the API slowly stops supporting old forks? It makes sense to support all forks forever for endpoints that read data from the blockchain, but for example proposing Phase0/Altair blocks doesn't seem useful anymore (actually we do propose Phase0 blocks in our end-to-end tests, but that's internal tooling).

author: radekkapka
content: Without dropping support the amount of code/tests will just keep growing endlessly

author: jgm
content:
I was wondering about this. But as you mention, many of the endpoints are still in use or somewhat in use. There isn't a massive amount beyond proposals that are outdated.

I think that there should be some sort of general agreement between teams to remove support for given forks, perhaps a policy like "support  the three prior forks" so we could remove support for phase0 come Electra, for example.

But I think the APIs should be updated based on some such policy, rather than us driving such a change.
